attributes.action: Ask MP Naz Shah why she didn't apologise for the Rotherham child abuse retweet
attributes.background:
MP for Bradford West Labour Naz Shah, shared a “hurtful” tweet saying child abuse victims “should keep their mouths shut” to resign.
It said: “Those abused girls in Rotherham and elsewhere just need to shut their mouths. For the good of diversity.”
She has never apologised.

rejection.details:
This would be a personal decision for the MP, not the responsibility of the UK Government and Parliament as a whole.

If you're concerned about a particular policy or decision that's the responsibility of Government or Parliament, you could start a petition about that.
